Crimes.Crime_Name: Possession with intent to traffic in a Schedule I substance
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in assessing the seriousness of Sanchez's U.S. convictions under Canadian law
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board relied on Ministerial submissions equating U.S. offenses to serious Canadian crimes; minor inconsistencies in testimony noted
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate eligibility for refugee protection
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Serious non-political crimes committed abroad can exclude refugee protection under Article 1F(b)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Assessment of foreign convictions under Canadian legal standards
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration and Refugee Board, reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No error found in procedural fairness
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: U.S. convictions for drug trafficking and assault, Ministerial submissions on equivalence to Canadian offenses
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Board's assessment of seriousness of U.S. convictions
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Lower than criminal conviction, higher than mere suspicion
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Claimed refugee status despite prior convictions
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court

Crimes.Threat_Source: Use of a weapon during assault
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use of a weapon, prior criminality
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Lenient sentence in U.S., not considered determinative
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Yes, including drug trafficking and assault
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient based on U.S. conviction records and statutory comparison
Crimes.Evidence_Type: U.S. conviction records, legal analysis linking NY statutes to Canadian equivalents
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Accepted as reliable by the Board and Court
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Minor inconsistencies in testimony, but not material
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Potential risk due to history of violent and drug-related offenses
Crimes.Geographic_Context: U.S. offense assessed under Canadian law
Crimes.Applicable_Statute: New York criminal statutes compared to Canadian law
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Lower than criminal conviction, higher than mere suspicion
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Lenient U.S. sentence not determinative of seriousness under Canadian law
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Assessment of foreign convictions for seriousness under domestic standards
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee status determination with exclusion analysis
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Ministry of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
